overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Pub/Sub.

First, install @google-cloud/pubsub with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/pubsub

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/pubsubâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var pubsub = require('@google-cloud/pubsub')();

Elsewhere

var pubsub = require('@google-cloud/pubsub')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/pubsub are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.name: SubscriberClient
methods.description:
The service that an application uses to manipulate subscriptions and to consume messages from a subscription via the Pull method.

This will be created through a builder function which can be obtained by the module. See the following example of how to initialize the module and how to access to the builder.

methods.name: projectPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified project resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromProjectName
methods.description: Parses the projectName from a project resource.

params.name: projectName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a project resources.

methods.name: snapshotPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified snapshot resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromSnapshotName
methods.description: Parses the snapshotName from a snapshot resource.

params.name: snapshotName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a snapshot resources.

methods.name: matchSnapshotFromSnapshotName
methods.description: Parses the snapshotName from a snapshot resource.

params.name: snapshotName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a snapshot resources.

methods.name: subscriptionPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified subscription resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromSubscriptionName
methods.description: Parses the subscriptionName from a subscription resource.

params.name: subscriptionName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a subscription resources.

methods.name: matchSubscriptionFromSubscriptionName
methods.description: Parses the subscriptionName from a subscription resource.

params.name: subscriptionName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a subscription resources.

methods.name: topicPath
methods.description: Returns a fully-qualified topic resource name string.

methods.name: matchProjectFromTopicName
methods.description: Parses the topicName from a topic resource.

params.name: topicName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a topic resources.

methods.name: matchTopicFromTopicName
methods.description: Parses the topicName from a topic resource.

params.name: topicName
params.description: A fully-qualified path representing a topic resources.

methods.name: getProjectId
methods.description: Get the project ID used by this class.

methods.name: createSubscription
methods.description:
Creates a subscription to a given topic. If the subscription already exists, returns ALREADY_EXISTS. If the corresponding topic doesn't exist, returns NOT_FOUND.

If the name is not provided in the request, the server will assign a random name for this subscription on the same project as the topic, conforming to the resource name format. The generated name is populated in the returned Subscription object. Note that for REST API requests, you must specify a name in the request.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: The name of the subscription. It must have the format "projects/{project}/subscriptions/{subscription}". {subscription} must start with a letter, and contain only letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers ([0-9]), dashes (-), underscores (_), periods (.), tildes (~), plus (+) or percent signs (%). It must be between 3 and 255 characters in length, and it must not start with "goog".

params.name: request.topic
params.description: The name of the topic from which this subscription is receiving messages. Format is projects/{project}/topics/{topic}. The value of this field will be _deleted-topic_ if the topic has been deleted.

params.name: request.pushConfig
params.description:
If push delivery is used with this subscription, this field is used to configure it. An empty pushConfig signifies that the subscriber will pull and ack messages using API methods.

This object should have the same structure as PushConfig PushConfig

params.name: request.ackDeadlineSeconds
params.description:
This value is the maximum time after a subscriber receives a message before the subscriber should acknowledge the message. After message delivery but before the ack deadline expires and before the message is acknowledged, it is an outstanding message and will not be delivered again during that time (on a best-effort basis).

For pull subscriptions, this value is used as the initial value for the ack deadline. To override this value for a given message, call ModifyAckDeadline with the corresponding ack_id if using pull. The minimum custom deadline you can specify is 10 seconds. The maximum custom deadline you can specify is 600 seconds (10 minutes). If this parameter is 0, a default value of 10 seconds is used.

For push delivery, this value is also used to set the request timeout for the call to the push endpoint.

If the subscriber never acknowledges the message, the Pub/Sub system will eventually redeliver the message.

params.name: request.retainAckedMessages
params.description: Indicates whether to retain acknowledged messages. If true, then messages are not expunged from the subscription's backlog, even if they are acknowledged, until they fall out of the message_retention_duration window.

params.name: request.messageRetentionDuration
params.description:
How long to retain unacknowledged messages in the subscription's backlog, from the moment a message is published. If retain_acked_messages is true, then this also configures the retention of acknowledged messages, and thus configures how far back in time a Seek can be done. Defaults to 7 days. Cannot be more than 7 days or less than 10 minutes.

This object should have the same structure as google.protobuf.Duration

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Subscription Subscription.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Subscription Subscription. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: getSubscription
methods.description: Gets the configuration details of a subscription.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.subscription
params.description: The name of the subscription to get. Format is projects/{project}/subscriptions/{sub}.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Subscription Subscription.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Subscription Subscription. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: updateSubscription
methods.description: Updates an existing subscription. Note that certain properties of a subscription, such as its topic, are not modifiable.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.subscription
params.description:
The updated subscription object.

This object should have the same structure as Subscription Subscription

params.name: request.updateMask
params.description:
Indicates which fields in the provided subscription to update. Must be specified and non-empty.

This object should have the same structure as google.protobuf.FieldMask

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Subscription Subscription.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Subscription Subscription. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listSubscriptions
methods.description: Lists matching subscriptions.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.project
params.description: The name of the cloud project that subscriptions belong to. Format is projects/{project}.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is Array of Subscription Subscription.

When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, it contains the result in a single response. If the response indicates the next page exists, the third parameter is set to be used for the next request object. The fourth parameter keeps the raw response object of an object representing ListSubscriptionsResponse ListSubscriptionsResponse.

returns.description:
• The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is Array of Subscription Subscription.

    When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, the array has three elements. The first element is Array of Subscription Subscription in a single response. The second element is the next request object if the response indicates the next page exists, or null. The third element is an object representing ListSubscriptionsResponse ListSubscriptionsResponse.

    The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listSubscriptionsStream
methods.description:
Equivalent to {@link listSubscriptions}, but returns a NodeJS Stream object.

This fetches the paged responses for {@link listSubscriptions} continuously and invokes the callback registered for 'data' event for each element in the responses.

The returned object has 'end' method when no more elements are required.

autoPaginate option will be ignored.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.project
params.description: The name of the cloud project that subscriptions belong to. Format is projects/{project}.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

returns.description: An object stream which emits an object representing Subscription Subscription on 'data' event.

methods.name: deleteSubscription
methods.description: Deletes an existing subscription. All messages retained in the subscription are immediately dropped. Calls to Pull after deletion will return NOT_FOUND. After a subscription is deleted, a new one may be created with the same name, but the new one has no association with the old subscription or its topic unless the same topic is specified.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.subscription
params.description: The subscription to delete. Format is projects/{project}/subscriptions/{sub}.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves when API call finishes. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: modifyAckDeadline
methods.description: Modifies the ack deadline for a specific message. This method is useful to indicate that more time is needed to process a message by the subscriber, or to make the message available for redelivery if the processing was interrupted. Note that this does not modify the subscription-level ackDeadlineSeconds used for subsequent messages.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.subscription
params.description: The name of the subscription. Format is projects/{project}/subscriptions/{sub}.

params.name: request.ackIds
params.description: List of acknowledgment IDs.

params.name: request.ackDeadlineSeconds
params.description: The new ack deadline with respect to the time this request was sent to the Pub/Sub system. For example, if the value is 10, the new ack deadline will expire 10 seconds after the ModifyAckDeadline call was made. Specifying zero may immediately make the message available for another pull request. The minimum deadline you can specify is 0 seconds. The maximum deadline you can specify is 600 seconds (10 minutes).

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves when API call finishes. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: acknowledge
methods.description:
Acknowledges the messages associated with the ack_ids in the AcknowledgeRequest. The Pub/Sub system can remove the relevant messages from the subscription.

Acknowledging a message whose ack deadline has expired may succeed, but such a message may be redelivered later. Acknowledging a message more than once will not result in an error.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.subscription
params.description: The subscription whose message is being acknowledged. Format is projects/{project}/subscriptions/{sub}.

params.name: request.ackIds
params.description: The acknowledgment ID for the messages being acknowledged that was returned by the Pub/Sub system in the Pull response. Must not be empty.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves when API call finishes. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: pull
methods.description: Pulls messages from the server. Returns an empty list if there are no messages available in the backlog. The server may return UNAVAILABLE if there are too many concurrent pull requests pending for the given subscription.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.subscription
params.description: The subscription from which messages should be pulled. Format is projects/{project}/subscriptions/{sub}.

params.name: request.maxMessages
params.description: The maximum number of messages returned for this request. The Pub/Sub system may return fewer than the number specified.

params.name: request.returnImmediately
params.description: If this field set to true, the system will respond immediately even if it there are no messages available to return in the Pull response. Otherwise, the system may wait (for a bounded amount of time) until at least one message is available, rather than returning no messages. The client may cancel the request if it does not wish to wait any longer for the response.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing PullResponse PullResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing PullResponse PullResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: streamingPull
methods.description:
(EXPERIMENTAL) StreamingPull is an experimental feature. This RPC will respond with UNIMPLEMENTED errors unless you have been invited to test this feature. Contact cloud-pubsub@google.com with any questions.

Establishes a stream with the server, which sends messages down to the client. The client streams acknowledgements and ack deadline modifications back to the server. The server will close the stream and return the status on any error. The server may close the stream with status OK to reassign server-side resources, in which case, the client should re-establish the stream. UNAVAILABLE may also be returned in the case of a transient error (e.g., a server restart). These should also be retried by the client. Flow control can be achieved by configuring the underlying RPC channel.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

methods.name: modifyPushConfig
methods.description:
Modifies the PushConfig for a specified subscription.

This may be used to change a push subscription to a pull one (signified by an empty PushConfig) or vice versa, or change the endpoint URL and other attributes of a push subscription. Messages will accumulate for delivery continuously through the call regardless of changes to the PushConfig.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.subscription
params.description: The name of the subscription. Format is projects/{project}/subscriptions/{sub}.

params.name: request.pushConfig
params.description:
The push configuration for future deliveries.

An empty pushConfig indicates that the Pub/Sub system should stop pushing messages from the given subscription and allow messages to be pulled and acknowledged - effectively pausing the subscription if Pull is not called.

This object should have the same structure as PushConfig PushConfig

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves when API call finishes. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listSnapshots
methods.description: Lists the existing snapshots.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.project
params.description: The name of the cloud project that snapshots belong to. Format is projects/{project}.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is Array of Snapshot Snapshot.

When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, it contains the result in a single response. If the response indicates the next page exists, the third parameter is set to be used for the next request object. The fourth parameter keeps the raw response object of an object representing ListSnapshotsResponse ListSnapshotsResponse.

returns.description:
• The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is Array of Snapshot Snapshot.

    When autoPaginate: false is specified through options, the array has three elements. The first element is Array of Snapshot Snapshot in a single response. The second element is the next request object if the response indicates the next page exists, or null. The third element is an object representing ListSnapshotsResponse ListSnapshotsResponse.

    The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: listSnapshotsStream
methods.description:
Equivalent to {@link listSnapshots}, but returns a NodeJS Stream object.

This fetches the paged responses for {@link listSnapshots} continuously and invokes the callback registered for 'data' event for each element in the responses.

The returned object has 'end' method when no more elements are required.

autoPaginate option will be ignored.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.project
params.description: The name of the cloud project that snapshots belong to. Format is projects/{project}.

params.name: request.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of resources in a page.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

returns.description: An object stream which emits an object representing Snapshot Snapshot on 'data' event.

methods.name: createSnapshot
methods.description:
Creates a snapshot from the requested subscription. If the snapshot already exists, returns ALREADY_EXISTS. If the requested subscription doesn't exist, returns NOT_FOUND.

If the name is not provided in the request, the server will assign a random name for this snapshot on the same project as the subscription, conforming to the resource name format. The generated name is populated in the returned Snapshot object. Note that for REST API requests, you must specify a name in the request.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.name
params.description: Optional user-provided name for this snapshot. If the name is not provided in the request, the server will assign a random name for this snapshot on the same project as the subscription. Note that for REST API requests, you must specify a name. Format is projects/{project}/snapshots/{snap}.

params.name: request.subscription
params.description: The subscription whose backlog the snapshot retains. Specifically, the created snapshot is guaranteed to retain: (a) The existing backlog on the subscription. More precisely, this is defined as the messages in the subscription's backlog that are unacknowledged upon the successful completion of the CreateSnapshot request; as well as: (b) Any messages published to the subscription's topic following the successful completion of the CreateSnapshot request. Format is projects/{project}/subscriptions/{sub}.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Snapshot Snapshot.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Snapshot Snapshot. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: deleteSnapshot
methods.description: Removes an existing snapshot. All messages retained in the snapshot are immediately dropped. After a snapshot is deleted, a new one may be created with the same name, but the new one has no association with the old snapshot or its subscription, unless the same subscription is specified.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.snapshot
params.description: The name of the snapshot to delete. Format is projects/{project}/snapshots/{snap}.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description: The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves when API call finishes. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: seek
methods.description: Seeks an existing subscription to a point in time or to a given snapshot, whichever is provided in the request.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.subscription
params.description: The subscription to affect.

params.name: request.time
params.description:
The time to seek to. Messages retained in the subscription that were published before this time are marked as acknowledged, and messages retained in the subscription that were published after this time are marked as unacknowledged. Note that this operation affects only those messages retained in the subscription (configured by the combination of message_retention_duration and retain_acked_messages). For example, if time corresponds to a point before the message retention window (or to a point before the system's notion of the subscription creation time), only retained messages will be marked as unacknowledged, and already-expunged messages will not be restored.

This object should have the same structure as google.protobuf.Timestamp

params.name: request.snapshot
params.description: The snapshot to seek to. The snapshot's topic must be the same as that of the provided subscription. Format is projects/{project}/snapshots/{snap}.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing SeekResponse SeekResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing SeekResponse SeekResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: setIamPolicy
methods.description: Sets the access control policy on the specified resource. Replaces any existing policy.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.resource
params.description: REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being specified. resource is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project resource is specified as projects/{project}.

params.name: request.policy
params.description:
REQUIRED: The complete policy to be applied to the resource. The size of the policy is limited to a few 10s of KB. An empty policy is a valid policy but certain Cloud Platform services (such as Projects) might reject them.

This object should have the same structure as Policy Policy

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Policy Policy.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Policy Policy. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: getIamPolicy
methods.description: Gets the access control policy for a resource. Returns an empty policy if the resource exists and does not have a policy set.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.resource
params.description: REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being requested. resource is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project resource is specified as projects/{project}.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing Policy Policy.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing Policy Policy. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: testIamPermissions
methods.description: Returns permissions that a caller has on the specified resource. If the resource does not exist, this will return an empty set of permissions, not a NOT_FOUND error.

params.name: request
params.description: The request object that will be sent.

params.name: request.resource
params.description: REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy detail is being requested. resource is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project resource is specified as projects/{project}.

params.name: request.permissions
params.description: The set of permissions to check for the resource. Permissions with wildcards (such as '' or 'storage.') are not allowed. For more information see IAM Overview.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional parameters. You can override the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout, retries, paginations, etc. See gax.CallOptions for the details.

params.name: callback
params.description:
The function which will be called with the result of the API call.

The second parameter to the callback is an object representing TestIamPermissionsResponse TestIamPermissionsResponse.

returns.description: • The promise which resolves to an array. The first element of the array is an object representing TestIamPermissionsResponse TestIamPermissionsResponse. The promise has a method named "cancel" which cancels the ongoing API call.

methods.name: subscriberClient
methods.description: Build a new instance of {@link SubscriberClient}.

params.name: opts
params.description: • The optional parameters.

params.name: opts.servicePath
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host.

params.name: opts.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host.

params.name: opts.sslCreds
params.description: A ClientCredentials for use with an SSL-enabled channel.

params.name: opts.clientConfig
params.description: The customized config to build the call settings. See {@link gax.constructSettings} for the format.
